embeds.title: Strike of Genius
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 2 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

At the start of your turn, gain a random  (**Upgrade**d) "Strike".
It costs 0 until played and gains **Exhaust**.

messages.content: I feel like I take alot of finishers personally
Taking multiple finishers is a big consistency hit.
It makes both your finishers and your combos worse, especially the finishers by making them dead cards given bad luck.
If you are a finisher and you don't provide free value or outdamage execute, you probably suck.

A very, very powerful starter card, that really contributes to champs dominant early game. Quite easy to stack a bit if vigor before casting this with berserker shout and skill bonuses to increase its damage even higher, and upgrading either card at the first campfire can let this delete enemies most of the time you draw it. It can even block for you while doing all this if you enter defensive stance first for the few fights where it doesn't deal enough damage to end things right away. You have such a leg up over the act 1 elites when you start the run with this kind of targeted frontloaded nuke in your deck that can delete an outer sentry, kill nob before it even gets to turn 3, and chunk lagavulin out before it can start lowering your strength/dex, letting you easily take 4 elites if you can find a route that has that many.

Most of why this is so good is because it's a starter card, you get it at exactly the right moment for it to shine, and as a double hit/finisher it gives you a vigor payoff right away, as well as some extra frontloaded block or strength scaling in the fights where you need them. It still remains good well into act 3, as there are still plenty of fights that reward this kind of burst damage, and you can get even better at vigor stacking as the run goes on. You will definitely want to be careful to ensure that you are adding more stance entry cards as your deck gets larger to support this, especially as you pickup additional finishers (many of which are excellent, but there is a lot of anti-synergy in a deck running 5+ finishers). Do keep in mind that champs hardest fight by far is neow due to god of life and invincible, which hard counter your strongest attribute (burst damage). You will need to find some way to deal more sustained damage, scale offensively, and block throughout that fight, because execute/other burst damage cards can't carry you anymore.

Upgrade is very good, effectively a +6, very good if taken early in the run to delete enemies more reliably. Excellent with snecko eye, and pretty good with runic pyramid to increase consistency. Note that this has a nonbo with necronomicon, since the second copy will fizzle after the initial version took you out of a stance.
unless you're in ultimate stance

I think that when talking about the execute upgrade it's also worth mentioning the berserker's shout upgrade, because it's an equal amount of damage added to execute but also scales fan of knives, the second early mid and semi late game burst damage darling.
of course, upgrade both when possible, but I prefer the berserker's shout upgrade first

messages.content: and cheap shot if unupgraded which trivializes hallways
why yes i would like two free turns for two energy

Execute helps champ trivialize act 1, you always upgrade it and doing so grants you a 2 cost card that deals at least 18 damage while also providing a finisher effect. Execute lets you delete lagavulin and blocks vs gremlin nob or kills it. Sentries and Ironcald are the only act 1 fights this card isnt great it, but even then you can still use it at least once per fight. Execute + champs beefy 80 base hit points lets you path really aggressively in act 1 skipping hallway fights for question marks to try and seize the valuable event relics while still smashing elites.

Execute will end up getting outshadowed by attacks that scale better later in the run and can be a dead draw, but its still better then defend and will stay in most champ decks for the whole game (pandoras box runs and those runs were you get the very balanced remove/transform 3 events will see you finally dropping execute). The fact that champ can even consider dropping execute at all goes to show how powerful his attacks can become

its very similar to Eruption, it gets champ rolling right away and while you will eventually get something like Tantrum or Shield throw that end up being a lot stronger. You will still value having them in your deck in your average run. Although if possible watcher and champ can opt to remove them. Something that normal characters like ironclad and silent almost never even consider doing (bash and neutralize can be outclassed, but its super rare that removing them from your deck is acutally the right call)
Bash I could see replaced sometimes under certain conditions (having more vulnerable, since it being 2 cost can be annoying) but a 0 cost neutralize will almost never be useless.

With bash even though something like uppercut+ is just better, bash still is good to have in a 25+ card ironclad deck just to consistently apply vulnerable and ironclad has to remove all 5 strikes first before thinking about removing bash. (and silent has to really cut into her 5 strikes and 5 defends to consider dropping neutralize)
Yeah and I think it's easier to remove 5 strikes as ic than it is to remove 5 strikes and defends from silent
meanwhile watcher likes her decks thin and champ can make thicker decks but the ones that are bigger will have multiple finisher cards that can overlap with execute
excluding moment of truth which never overlaps with any finisher card because you can just retain it so it never gets in the way (another reason why its so powerful)
in champ and watcher having few starter strikes and defends is a small but important factor in their strength. not having to deal with 2 bad cards in your deck adds a lot more consistency
I know I'm like 7 hours late I fell asleep lol but what about <quickdraw>

messages.content: So your telling me you want a card that makes your next turn worse?
On a character with high burst damage that can end fights that turn, remove the debuffs, benefit from the debuffs, and has an extremely strong draw power yes.
It's not that the virtue combo doesn't work it's that it requires 2 cards which are basically the same 2 cards you would be drawing with qucikdraw
It's 1 card you are drawing (virtue) not two.
The Quickdraw itself counts
Most cards that draw just cycle themselves
Which isn't usually a bad thing
But making your next turn worse is just making me not want to take it
blasphemy, overwhelming power, no holds barred, gem cannon. All of these are cards that make your next turn(s) worse. None of these are considered bad.
No holds barred is very high aoe damage
And overwhelming power is literally just adrenaline but with offering moment
Both great cards for ending fights quicker
My point is that just because a card sacrifices later power for more now it doesn't mean it's bad.
Quickdraw does has some combos though so I would be lying if I said it was useless
and quickdraw isn't? It lets you draw into those powerful cards earlier.
I'd just rather have other draw cards though is all I'm saying
If I'm doing a dead on/magnum deck though then I would love a quickdraw
All of hermit's draw options are situational and balanced, there is always a situation where you'd want a specific one over the others for each one.
Luck of the draw is just very good in the curse archetype
Spite with curses, Luck of the Draw with 0 cost/curses, Quickdraw for more burst.
Quickdraw is basically a card that you really need to be killing that turn if you don't want the downside
Spite gets overshadowed by LotD pretty hard, but it's not useless. I'd say it's probably hermit's worst card if not in the top 3.
Spite will at least have memento
also that downside can make your dead on cards guaranteed to activate next turn in act 1 (assuming you have 3 energy and they're all 1 cost)
Quickdraw is good with dead on as well because combo exists
Also drawing one less obviously making dead on easier
Which you just said lol should've read that first

Yeah everything on hermit is two-fold. Stuff that looks like a negative can have positives within it. Both on a very obvious scale (curse generation isn't always a downside) and even on a smaller scale such as less draw
Assuming you play the memento of course
